result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:30 PM Defendant Kardea D Murray in court.  Attorney Olivia G Garman in court for Kardea D Murray.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to Suppress on file. Officer Zilke sworn and testifies. State rests. Argument made by State. Argument made by Counsel. Court as to motion, denies motion. Counsel advises has received offer from State.
Status hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:50 PM Defendant Kardea D Murray in court.  Attorney Olivia G Garman in court for Kardea D Murray.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has scheduled a motion to Suppress that is set for 10/11/22. Pretrial has not been conducted yet.
Motion to Suppress scheduled for 10/11/22 3:30pm for 1 hour hearing. District Atty and Defense counsel confirmed availability

1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kardea D Murray appeared by video, in custody. Atty Rachel Boaz appears stating defendant will not qualify for public defender representation. Court finds probable cause. State requests $1000 cash bail with conditions. Court finds good cause to extend any time limits for defendant to hire an attorney.
Status hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
